brief_summary.textblock:
Diabetes mellitus is known to increase the risk of premature death in the general
      population. In this study, the investigators examine the impact of body mass index (BMI)
      levels, waist circumference, and presence/absence of diabetes on all-cause and
      cardiovascular mortality in elderly Koreans.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between Mortality and Diabetes in Elderly Koreans: the South-West Seoul (SWS) Study

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators analyze follow-up data from the South-West Seoul (SWS) Study, a
      prospective observational cohort study of an elderly Korean population residing in Seoul,
      the metropolitan capital city of Korea.

      Briefly, the study population was selected from four urban districts (Guro, Yangcheon,
      Gwanak and Gangseo) located in the south-west area of Seoul. A total of 1737 apparently
      healthy individuals (between 60 and 92 years of age) eventually participated in this survey
      starting in 1999. A follow-up examination was performed in 2002, and an additional 873
      subjects who had not participated in the first examination were newly recruited.

      After a median follow-up of 10 years, each subject`s vital status or cause of death as of 31
      December 2011 was determined after linking these cohort data with death certificate data
      from the Korean National Statistical Office. Terminology and codes from the International
      Classification of Disease, Tenth Revision (ICD-10), were used to classify the underlying
      cause of death due to cardiovascular disease (ICD-10 codes I00-I79), cancer (ICD-10 codes
      C00-C97) and others.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Apparently healthy individuals

          -  Over the age of 60 years

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Those with a mismatched identification number

          -  Missing data regarding BMI, waist circumference, and presence of diabetes

study_pop.textblock:
Study subjects in South-West Seoul (SWS) study, a prospective observational cohort study
        of an elderly Korean population residing in Seoul, the metropolitan capital city of Korea.

primary_outcome.measure: All-cause and cardiovascular mortality in elderly Korean men and women according to BMI, waist circumference, and presence of diabetes

reference.citation: Choi KM, Lee J, Kim DR, Kim SK, Shin DH, Kim NH, Park IB, Choi DS, Baik SH. Comparison of ADA and WHO criteria for the diagnosis of diabetes in elderly Koreans. Diabet Med. 2002 Oct;19(10):853-7.

Choi KM, Lee J, Kim KB, Kim DR, Kim SK, Shin DH, Kim NH, Park IB, Choi DS, Baik SH; South-west Seoul Study. Factor analysis of the metabolic syndrome among elderly Koreans--the South-west Seoul Study. Diabet Med. 2003 Feb;20(2):99-104.

Kim NH, Cho HJ, Kim YJ, Cho MJ, Choi HY, Eun CR, Kim JH, Yang SJ, Yoo HJ, Kim HY, Seo JA, Kim SG, Baik SH, Choi DS, Choi KM. Combined effect of high-normal blood pressure and low HDL cholesterol on mortality in an elderly Korean population: the South-West Seoul (SWS) study. Am J Hypertens. 2011 Aug;24(8):918-23. doi: 10.1038/ajh.2011.78. Epub 2011 Apr 28.
